column2: This law determines who is favored in the realm's taxation.
This law determines the freedom of vassals to dispose over their own levies.
This law determines the freedom of the ruler to dismiss councillors.
Crown revenues are increased at the expense of the vassals.
Vassal and crown revenues are set at the same level.
Vassal revenues are increased at the expense of the crown.
Vassals must contribute all levies reserved for the crown to wars.
Vassals are free to choose how large a portion of their levies they wish to contribute to wars.
Councillors are freely appointed and dismissed by the crown.
Our liege's laws require us to pay an additional portion of our revenues to the crown.
Our liege's laws allow us to raise additional revenues at the expense of the crown.
